Comments_List: The importance in developing a voice/perspective through photographic texts, and properly attending to the implications that work sets forth.
a good follow up to intro

I really learned how to use medium format cameras - and this technical aspect of the course is really pretty essential. Using medium format is not much like 35mm - you need to really think about what you're doing. This changes the whole photographic process, and I found myself making very different (and exciting) work that I couldn't have done had I just stuck with an SLR.

Strengths: focus on photograph histories and traditions 

Weakness: focus on Yale alum

The course is certainly very hands off - and I liked that. I was able to just go off and do my own thing while using all of yale's facilities. But perhaps it would have been nicer to have more seminars like the one about writing for art. Getting people really engaged during those classroom sessions is very rewarding.
yes! but be ready to work independently

Absolutely - you're going to be a better and different photographer after taking this class. Also, you already know that it's going to be a heavy workload, so just do it and love it. Our class formed a really close bond over long hours spent in the darkroom.
